segment.source: How to Test URL Redirection
segment.target: How to Test URL Redirection

segment.source: How to Test URL Redirection
segment.target: How to Test URL Redirection

segment.source: How to Test URL Redirection
segment.target: How to Test URL Redirection

segment.source: After your test of first time setup finishes, you can verify that the URL redirection functionality is working as expected by performing the following tasks.
segment.target: After your test of first time setup finishes, you can verify that the URL redirection functionality is working as expected by performing the following tasks.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The MED-V Host Agent must be running for URL redirection to function correctly.
segment.target: The MED-V Host Agent must be running for URL redirection to function correctly.

segment.source: To test URL Redirection
segment.target: To test URL Redirection

segment.source: Open an Internet Explorer browser in the host computer and enter a URL that you specified for redirection.
segment.target: Open an Internet Explorer browser in the host computer and enter a URL that you specified for redirection.

segment.source: Verify that the webpage is opened in Internet Explorer on the guest virtual machine.
segment.target: Verify that the webpage is opened in Internet Explorer on the guest virtual machine.

segment.source: Repeat this process for each URL that you want to test.
segment.target: Repeat this process for each URL that you want to test.

segment.source: To test that a URL can be added or removed
segment.target: To test that a URL can be added or removed

segment.source: Add or remove a URL from the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Add or remove a URL from the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: For information about how to add and remove URLs for redirection on a MED-V workspace, see Manage MED-V URL Redirection.
segment.target: For information about how to add and remove URLs for redirection on a MED-V workspace, see Manage MED-V URL Redirection.

segment.source: If you added a URL to the redirection list, repeat the steps in To Test URL Redirection to verify that the new URL redirects as intended.
segment.target: If you added a URL to the redirection list, repeat the steps in To Test URL Redirection to verify that the new URL redirects as intended.

segment.source: If you removed a URL from the redirection list, verify that it is removed by following these steps:
segment.target: If you removed a URL from the redirection list, verify that it is removed by following these steps:

segment.source: Open an Internet Explorer browser in the host computer and enter the URL that you removed from the redirection list.
segment.target: Open an Internet Explorer browser in the host computer and enter the URL that you removed from the redirection list.

segment.source: Verify that the webpage is opened in Internet Explorer on the host computer instead of on the guest virtual machine.
segment.target: Verify that the webpage is opened in Internet Explorer on the host computer instead of on the guest virtual machine.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It can take several seconds for the URL redirection changes to take place.
segment.target: It can take several seconds for the URL redirection changes to take place.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you encounter any problems when verifying your URL redirection settings, see Operations Troubleshooting.
segment.target: If you encounter any problems when verifying your URL redirection settings, see Operations Troubleshooting.

segment.source: After you have completed testing URL redirection in your MED-V workspace, you can test other configurations to verify that they function as intended.
segment.target: After you have completed testing URL redirection in your MED-V workspace, you can test other configurations to verify that they function as intended.

segment.source: After you have completed testing your MED-V workspace package and have verified that it is functioning as intended, you can deploy the MED-V workspace to your enterprise.
segment.target: After you have completed testing your MED-V workspace package and have verified that it is functioning as intended, you can deploy the MED-V workspace to your enterprise.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Test Application Publishing
